column2:
character
  1. The first letter of the Kikuyu alphabet, written in the Latin script.

name
  1. name of one of the ruling generation-sets (mariika); the other is Mwangi.

name
  1. name of one of the two ruling generation-sets (mariika); the other is Maina.

verb
  1. to lack, to miss, to fail to find

verb
  1. to peg (out), to pitch
  2. to stretch out
  3. to do first

verb
  1. to come up, to go up, to ascend

verb
  1. (transitive) to split, to divide, to part

verb
  1. to bring forth, to give birth, to give rise
  2. to bear (fruit)
  3. to adopt

verb
  1. to hoe, to dig with a hoe

verb
  1. to give back, to put back
  2. to reply, to answer

proverb
  1. no smoke without fire (lit. little one does not squeak without being pinched)

noun
  1. Dwarf Cavendish banana, a cultivar, (Musa acuminata Colla (AAA Group) 'Dwarf Cavendish')
  2. Bandé banana
  3. (common) purslane (Portulaca oleracea)

verb
  1. to count, to measure, to reckon
  2. to pass through

noun
  1. appointment for gathering
  2. prearranged meeting
  3. any social event where people gather at a market, feast; party

noun
  1. (idiomatic) An expression used for reminding a speaker's peer of a secret hide-out where they used to and are to meet. (lit. an appointment/a gathering of ticks)

noun
  1. an untidy, sprawling agglomeration of homesteads built by a mixed group of people from different clans or sub-clans
  2. a new village

noun
  1. mirror
  2. pane (for windows, doors, etc.)
  3. (in the plural) eyeglasses

noun
  1. ball of string or wool
  2. tied or rolled up bundle or load

noun
  1. A winnowing tray twined with bark of mũgio (Triumfetta brachyceras, syn. T. macrophylla, T. ruwenzorensis), a kind of shrub, used also as a server.

noun
  1. long narrow calabash with strap gruel or beer

noun
  1. a tin can with a stone put in, worn by boys on the calf of the leg during dances; a rattle

noun
  1. roughly built hut
  2. initiation candidates' hut built adjacent to the women's sleeping place of the senior co-wife's hut

noun
  1. candelabra tree, naboom (E. ingens); its latex may cause temporary blindness if applied to the eyes.
  2. E. bussei var. kibwezensis
  3. E. cussonioides

noun
  1. stew with potato, vegetable and sometimes meat

noun
  1. pyjama lily (Crinum kirkii); formerly planted for marking boundaries of individual land holdings.
  2. Cape coast lily, pyjama lily (Crinum macowanii)

noun
  1. headdress with feathers worn when a performer dances

proverb
  1. no gain without pain (lit. to warm oneself is to stoke the fire)

verb
  1. to paint, to smear
  2. to propitiate by gift
  3. to bribe

noun
  1. female goat that has not yet borne a kid

proverb
  1. when the cat's away the mice will play (lit. when hyenas go away, foxes play)

verb
  1. to ask for, to beg for
  2. to pray

verb
  1. to beat, to hit, to strike, to tap
  2. to pound
  3. to brew

verb
  1. to put
  2. to keep, to store, to put aside

verb
  1. to be sufficient, to be enough, to come up to a point, to be up to

noun
  1. piece of trona
  2. (plural only) bad scurf on head

verb
  1. to agree
  2. to be reconciled
  3. to be in one mind
  4. to be friendly

noun
  1. hump (especially one on the back of a cow)

noun
  1. Abyssinian banana, ensete (Ensete ventricosum, syn. E. edule)

noun
  1. (chiefly in plural) charcoal

verb
  1. to sit
  2. to stay, to remain
  3. to dwell

verb
  1. to put in, to throw, to dip

verb
  1. to arrest, to lay one's hands on, to give one's hands on

noun
  1. one of several knots made for counting days until the day, by which an appointment should be fulfilled, etc.

noun
  1. black nightshade (Solanum nigrum); its leaves have been traditionally regarded as edible.

verb
  1. to be black, to turn black
  2. to feel stinted of

noun
  1. poem, verse
  2. song with cryptic phrasing sung to the accompaniment of the gourd instrument (gĩcandĩ)
  3. epigram

noun
  1. ogre who appears in folktales and tends to eat human beings

verb
  1. to strangle
  2. to pour out, to pour away
  3. to leak

noun
  1. troop of warriors organized for a foray; a raiding party

verb
  1. to be full, to be plentiful
  2. to become full

proverb
  1. one hand washes the other, and both wash the face (lit. one tiny finger does not kill a louse)

noun
  1. Kei apple (Dovyalis caffra); introduced from Southern Africa, fruit edible, also used for hedging.

proverb
  1. many hands make light work (lit. a group of people lifts a mortar)

intj
  1. expression of astonishment or joy; my word!

verb
  1. to die
  2. to break into pieces, to fall into pieces

noun
  1. sjambok (a leather whip, especially made of hippopotamus' or rhinoceros' hide)

noun
  1. grief, sorrow, sadness, anxiety
  2. Englerina woodfordioides); parasitic plant found on trees, like mistletoe

noun
  1. factory, workshop
  2. blacksmith's or wiredrawer's shed or working hut; forge
  3. temporary hut for initiates

noun
  1. meeting
  2. gathering place, meeting place
  3. junction of two rivers; confluence, conflux

noun
  1. sugar cane; Kikuyu people use its juice for making alcoholic drink (njohi)

noun
  1. field or public place, public square
  2. court, which also implies a public place

phrase
  1. A riddle whose solution is mũkamo wa ng'ombe “cow's udder”; another solution is kĩnya.
  2. A fool who does not make use of an obvious opportunity.

noun
  1. place where animal or person sleeps; lair

noun
  1. thing
  2. (in the plural) property
  3. (in the plural) livestock

noun
  1. sore, ulcer; especially veld(t) sore, Barcoo rot, (diphtheric) desert sore, septic sore

noun
  1. section of log or pole
  2. chunk, hunk, joint (of meat)

noun
  1. a huge peapod-shaped cast iron containing iron balls, or an empty container filled with pieces of a bottle, used as a musical instrument for making rhythms of dances; tied to legs and shaking them would produce sounds like baca, baca, baca, baca...

noun
  1. shadow; traditionally regarded as a place where one's own spirit sits during his or her life
  2. shade

noun
  1. any being or animal with a congenital abnormality
  2. (obsolete) albino

proverb
  1. to flog a dead horse (lit. to pound water with a mortar)

verb
  1. to lead the chorus in song
  2. to sing solo

noun
  1. leaves on which an animal is slaughtered and cut up

noun
  1. castor bean
  2. castor oil; Kikuyu people use it for treating minor wounds and protecting skin, etc.

noun
  1. a curved stick one of whose ends is crooked and the other forked, used for suspending a beehive
  2. bandy-leggedness, bow-leggedness

noun
  1. oath taken with proper ritual before a tribunal of elders in daytime and in public

noun
  1. (blue) butterfly bush (Rotheca myricoides, syn. Clerodendrum myricoides)
  2. jammy mouth (Ruttya fruticosa)

noun
  1. (blue) butterfly bush (Rotheca myricoides, syn. Clerodendrum myricoides); recently reported that decoction of a shoot or roots used for treating STDs, including syphilis and gonorrhea.
  2. Pavetta elliottii
  3. jammy mouth (Ruttya fruticosa)

noun
  1. young male person who has gone through circumcision but is not yet married

noun
  1. beehive made of tree trunk split in two and hollowed out
  2. cylindrical wooden barrel whose both ends have lids, used for storage in the home

noun
  1. pearl millet, bulrush millet (Pennisetum glaucum)
  2. finger millet (Eleusine coracana)
  3. field of bulrush millet or finger millet

noun
  1. peanut butter cassia, candelabra tree (Senna didymobotrya); traditionally used as a purgative, etc.

noun
  1. odd timewasting jobs, busy activity of any kind

noun
  1. Rytigynia uhligii (syn. R. schumannii）
  2. Canthium oligocarpum subsp. friesiorum (syn. Rytigynia friesiorum)

noun
  1. East African olive, Elgon olive (Olea capensis subsp. macrocarpa, syn. O. hochstetteri); its timber is traded internationally.
  2. Elgon olive (Olea welwitschii, syn. Linociera welwitschii)
  3. Cape chestnut (Calodendrum capense)

proverb
  1. he who keeps company with the wolf, will learn to howl like a wolf (lit. one who walks with a scoundrel turns bad like him)

noun
  1. Afrocrania volkensii (syn. Cornus volkensii), a timber-tree of the family Cornaceae.

noun
  1. Premna maxima, a tree species of the family Lamiaceae (formerly Verbenaceae); endemic to Kenya, producing timber, but in the IUCN Red List evaluated as 'Endangered' due to probable habitat loss caused by local development.

noun
  1. singed food found on the bottom of a pot

noun
  1. fairly long tail of any animal
  2. (Kabete) penis

noun
  1. neck of a calabash cut in a half, used as a handle

noun
  1. gravy, broth
  2. Agelaea pentagyna (syn. A. heterophylla); according to Leakey (1977), it was used for making tonic soup.

noun
  1. red acacia (Vachellia seyal, syn. Acacia stenocarpa, A. seyal)
  2. (in the singular) rainless hot period at end of one growing season and before the long or short rains begin

noun
  1. Cape myrtle (Myrsine africana)
  2. Myrsine rhododendroides, syn. Rapanea rhododendroides

noun
  1. stout log
  2. fallen or felled trunk
  3. log bridge, trunk bridge

noun
  1. column (of ants, etc.)
  2. trail of column of ants; used by them in their usual activity

noun
  1. giant lobelia (Lobelia giberroa); its stem was used as a substitute for blowing horn

noun
  1. endod, African soapberry (Phytolacca dodecandra; though very poisonous, parts of this plant were traditionally used for treating cattle sickness and as aperient for human being.
  2. soap berry (Deinbollia kilimandscharica)

noun
  1. plank used as circular external wall of a hut or internal dividing wall

noun
  1. muhugu, muhuhu (Brachylaena huillensis, syn. B. hutchinsii); Kikuyu people have used this species for firewood, poles, partitioning walls (mĩhĩrĩgo), etc.

noun
  1. (chiefly in plural) respiration
  2. (chiefly in plural) deep-breathing
  3. (chiefly in plural) panting

noun
  1. Oncoba routledgei
  2. fried egg tree, snuff-box tree (Oncoba spinosa)

noun
  1. Oncoba routledgei
  2. snuff-box tree, fried egg tree (Oncoba spinosa)

noun
  1. red stinkwood, African cherry, African plum, African prune (Prunus africana, syn. Pygeum africanum

noun
  1. orange-milk tree (Harungana madagascariensis); contains red sap and wood used for building material.

noun
  1. milkweed, swan plant, wild cotton (Gomphocarpus physocarpus, syn. Asclepias physocarpa and G. fruticosus)

noun
  1. Margaritaria discoidea (syn. Phyllanthus discoideus), a deciduous tree of the family Phyllanthaceae (formerly Euphorbiaceae); traditionally used for making planks (mĩhĩrĩgo).

noun
  1. any species of the genus Commelina, especially wandering Jew (C. benghalensis)

noun
  1. coast goldleaf, coastal goldenleaf, sweetberry (Bridelia micrantha); traditionally used for building material

noun
  1. Psychotria fractinervata (syn. Grumilea exserta)
  2. Galiniera saxifraga (syn. G. coffeoides) (Rubiaceae)

noun
  1. Kilimanjaro mahogany, brown mahogany (Lovoa swynnertonii); produces timber of good quality
  2. mortar for making sugar-cane beer; according to Leakey (1977), it was made of red stinkwood (mũiri).

noun
  1. Afrocrania volkensii, a timber-tree of the family Cornaceae

noun
  1. awl, especially for sewing leather, skin garments, etc.

noun
  1. Senegal date palm, wild date palm (Phoenix reclinata)

noun
  1. Mitragyna rubrostipulata (syn. Fleroya rubrostipulata); yields timber.
  2. Meyna tetraphylla
  3. evil person, corrupted person; scum

noun
  1. Commiphora eminii subsp. zimmermannii), tree of the family Burseraceae; traditionally used by Kikuyu people for hedging, supporter of yam vine, and so on.

noun
  1. muna (Pouteria adolfi-friedericii, syn. Aningeria adolfi-friedericii); yields timber.

noun
  1. a person who performs healing and divination practices; medicine man

noun
  1. long and quite heavy digging pole with the digging end pointed, used for first breaking up of land

noun
  1. pin-tailed whydah (Vidua macroura)
  2. paradise flycatcher (Terpsiphone spp.); in Kenya, where Kikuyu people live, at least two species are found: red-bellied paradise flycatcher (T. rufiventer) and African paradise flycatcher (T. viridis).

noun
  1. species of bamboo (Oldeania alpina, syns. Yushania alpina, Arundinaria alpina)

noun
  1. first rafters to be set in position
  2. (Northern) a bent stick over tops of posts supporting a roof on which rafters are placed
  3. one of the traditional season, part of the months from September to December

noun
  1. sausage tree; its ripe fruits are used for fermenting sugar-cane beverage and in Nyeri County, decoction of the leaves, barks and fruits is allegedly used for treating gonorrhoea, syphilis, measles, etc.
  2. a type of alcoholic beverage, especially made from sugar-cane fermented with a thoroughly dried sausage tree fruit

noun
  1. Canthium oligocarpum subsp. friesiorum (syn. Rytigynia friesiorum), shrub or tree species of the family Rubiaceae

noun
  1. disease, illness, sickness; traditionally referring to ones that were thought to be caused by supernatural beings.

noun
  1. large-leafed cordia (Cordia africana, syn. C. abyssinica, C. holstii); traditionally used for making hives and stools

noun
  1. Mussaenda microdonta subsp. odorata (syn. M. odorata); tree or shrub of the family Rubiaceae

noun
  1. one who harms others by practising witchcraft or black magic; wizard, sorcerer

noun
  1. Bersama abyssinica, a shrub or tree of the family Francoaceae (formerly Melianthaceae)

noun
  1. side of a river or a valley

noun
  1. sick person, patient
  2. crowned crane, golden crested crane, Kavirondo crane (Balearica sp.)

noun
  1. species of long-tailed widowbird, including Jackson's widowbird (Euplectes jacksoni)

noun
  1. slender mongoose (Herpestes sanguineus, syn. Galerella sanguinea)
  2. weasel
  3. serval (cat) (Leptailurus serval)

noun
  1. ramontchi, governor's plum, Indian plum (Flacourtia indica); fruit edible.
  2. forest pepper, Lopez root, wild orange tree (Toddalia asiatica)

noun
  1. forest pepper, Lopez root, wild orange tree (Toddalia asiatica); formerly its leaves and roots were used for treating feverish colds, and recently leaf decoction for colds, asthma, chest pain and toothache

noun
  1. wild olive, brown olive O. europaea subsp. africana, O. chrysophylla)

noun
  1. African pencil cedar, East African cedar (Juniperus procera)
  2. Mexican white cedar, Mexican cedar (Hesperocyparis lusitanica, syn. Cupressus lusitanica)

noun
  1. order, plan, method of activity, procedure
  2. row, line, column

noun
  1. Polyscias kikuyuensis; produces soft timber, used traditionally for making beehive and mole-trap.
  2. Polyscias fulva

noun
  1. forest peach (Rawsonia lucida (syn. R. usambarensis); produces timber.

noun
  1. misty season, from July to early September

noun
  1. East African camphorwood (Kuloa usambarensis; syn. Ocotea usambarensis) or Ocotea kenyensis; wood of at least the former one was used for making partitioning walls (mĩhĩrĩgo), containers related to honey, etc.

noun
  1. an individual with influence, who played the role of spokesman and primus inter pares in Kikuyu society before the colonial period, strictly controlled by his peers (Muriuki 1974:132)
  2. ruler; king or queen

noun
  1. Hypericum revolutum, a shrub or tree of the St. John's wort family (Hypericaceae)

noun
  1. old man
  2. honorific used for males older than a speaker and also for speaker's father especially in absent

noun
  1. canary-bird bush, birdflower, lion's claw, rattlebox (Crotalaria agatiflora)

noun
  1. hole or cavity under the ground made naturally or by ants

noun
  1. married male person with children,
  2. male person, man
  3. adult (man)
  4. elder

noun
  1. candelabra tree (Euphorbia ingens); its latex may cause temporary blindness if applied to the eyes.

noun
  1. apple of Sodom, Sodom's apple, bitter tomato (Solanum incanum and S. campylacanthum)

noun
  1. a certain kind of banana usually roasted or mashed before consumption

column1: mũtumia wa kĩero gĩtune|atumia a kĩero gĩtune
column2:
noun
  1. (idiomatic) a woman whose husbands die one after another (lit. a wife of a red thigh).

noun
  1. giant yellow mulberry (Myrianthus holstii and Myrianthus arboreus)

noun
  1. Galiniera saxifraga (syn. G. coffeoides); shrub or tree of the family Rubiaceae
  2. Turraea holstii
  3. Turraea abyssinica

noun
  1. rifle
  2. shot-gun
  3. Schrebera alata, tree of the family Oleaceae

noun
  1. forest fever tree (Anthocleista grandiflora, syn. Anthocleista zambesiaca)
  2. Mitragyna rubrostipulata (syn. Fleroya rubrostipulata), Rubiaceae; yields timber.
  3. Meyna tetraphylla (Rubiaceae)

noun
  1. bramble (Rubus spp.); berry at least of R. keniensis, R. pinnatus, R. steudneri, and R. volkensii

noun
  1. large and thin necked pot or jar used for storing water, millet, oil

noun
  1. wooden armshield used by male youngsters; see more on Ndome (Schild).

noun
  1. bongo (Tragelaphus eurycerus, syn. Boocercus eurycerus)
  2. greater kudu (Tragelaphus strepsiceros)

noun
  1. A club made of a pulled out shrub or sapling (of mũnderendu (Vepris spp., syn. Teclea spp.) according to Leakey (1977))

noun
  1. chigoe, chigoe flea, chigger, sand flea, jigger

noun
  1. wooden mortar for crushing sugar cane to make beer

proverb
  1. you should feed a hungry person/people first, then ask him/her/them what he/she/they need(s).
  2. you should feed a hungry person/people first before you try to obtain news from him/her/them.

noun
  1. fruit of some Primulaceae (Cape myrtle Myrsine africana or Rapanea rhododendroides); purple in color, turning to light brown when fully ripe, used as a general stomach medicine and as an anthelmintic

proverb
  1. when the cat's away, the mice will play (lit. when lions have gone, hyenas dance)

noun
  1. ululation made by women as an expression of joy

noun
  1. seed(s) of wild banana (Ensete ventricosum); formerly used for making special beads for ceremonial purposes.

noun
  1. cap, hat
  2. tilde (̃); a diacritical mark over vowel letter such as ĩ or ũ.

noun
  1. a kind of cowrie shell about 1/2 inch long, used as a charm

noun
  1. seed(s) of hyacinth bean (Lablab purpureus, syn. Dolichos lablab)

noun
  1. alcoholic beverage made from sugar-cane or honey
  2. any kind of alcoholic beverage

noun
  1. otter, especially spot-necked otter (Hydrictis maculicollis, syn. Lutra maculicollis)

noun
  1. Lima bean(s), butter bean(s), Madagascar bean(s) (Phaseolus lunatus)

noun
  1. a bird of the genus Cossypha, especially cape robin(-chat) (C. caffra, syn. Dessonornis caffer)

noun
  1. a certain species of snake; according to Hobley (1911:418) and Leakey (1977), it was the custom that the snake was treated with milk or fat poured out on the floor for drinking if the animal entered a hut and the snake was made to leave the hut lest the snake should be by any chance killed. Hobley also reports that Kikuyu people regarded the snake as incarnation of a spirit of the departed (ngoma).
  2. (in general) snake

column1: nyoneka na rua yũraga na rua
column2:
proverb
  1. easy come, easy go; quick come, quick go

noun
  1. Dwarf Cavendish banana a cultivar of Musa acuminata (Colla (AAA Group) 'Dwarf Cavendish')

noun
  1. house; a hut where woman lives
  2. lineage, family
  3. room

noun
  1. earthen pot used for cooking or keeping something

verb
  1. to see
  2. to find
  3. to get into, to find oneself (unusual situation)

verb
  1. to protect, to keep company (through the night)

verb
  1. to shoot
  2. (of celestial bodies) to rise
  3. to foresee
  4. to profess

noun
  1. group of the people who have been circumcised at the same time; used to play a role in tying up kinship relations such as mũhĩrĩga, mbarĩ and nyũmba; age group, age set

verb
  1. to take out from
  2. to remove, to take away
  3. to teach
  4. to obtain, to produce

noun
  1. one of the pegs used for stretching out hides and skins to dry up

verb
  1. to eat
  2. to hurt, to harm, to damage

verb
  1. to make (someone) eat forcefully
  2. to graze, to pasture

noun
  1. mixture of sand and clay used for making pottery

noun
  1. Psydrax parviflora,), tree of the madder family (Rubiaceae); yields timber.
  2. Psydrax schimperiana subsp. schimperiana; yields hard wood and is used for building.
  3. false turkey-berry, mottled-bark canthium (Psydrax livida); yields very hard wood.

noun
  1. flaky solder
  2. bee's sting left in skin
  3. peel of sugar-cane chipped off before eating

noun
  1. a place where a roof and wall meet inside a traditional hut
  2. a space under eaves outside a hut

noun
  1. ridge of land
  2. upper part of slope
  3. region forming a community whose borders are two rivers or valleys
  4. north or south

verb
  1. to bite
  2. to be firm
  3. to take a handful

noun
  1. bride price, bridewealth; cows, sheep, goats, cash, mead, etc. paid continuously by a groom to his father-in-law.

noun
  1. umbilical cord
  2. relationship, kinship
  3. button at the bottom of a gourd

adv
  1. quite harmoniously, harmoniously fit together (lit. “like a yam and a mũkũngũgũ tree”; this tree has been used traditionally for supporting yam vines, etc.)

noun
  1. small animal that breaks up beehives (mĩatũ) and steals all the honeycombs; honey badger, or ratel (Mellivora capensis)
  2. ichneumon, Egyptian mongoose (Herpestes ichneumon)

noun
  1. warmth of ashes of dead fire
  2. warm ashes

noun
  1. duiker (bush duiker or common duiker (Sylvicapra grimmia), etc.)

noun
  1. manure, fertilizer, obtained chiefly from cattle or sheep dung
  2. venom

noun
  1. Thomson's gazelle (Eudorcas thomsonii)
  2. Grant's gazelle (Nanger granti)
  3. impala (Aepyceros melampus)
  4. reedbuck (Redunca spp.)
  5. large duiker

verb
  1. to stop, to quit
  2. to leave, to quit

proverb
  1. a fool and his money are soon parted (lit. one who had eaten bothered one who had stored)

proverb
  1. charity begins at home (lit. goodness comes from home)

character
  1. The ninth letter of the Kikuyu alphabet, written in the Latin script.

verb
  1. (literally) to look for oneself
  2. to watch (matches, TV programmes, etc.)

verb
  1. to be afraid (lit. to stop for oneself)

character
  1. The eighteenth letter of the Kikuyu alphabet, written in the Latin script.

noun
  1. news, account, discourse, words, affair, matter, subject, theme, topic
  2. peace, well-being
